meta.title: Fundamental Rights - Constitution of India (Part III)
last_verified_sources: Government of India - Part III PDF (Ministry of External Affairs / Constitution text)

fundamental_rights.name: Right to Equality
fundamental_rights.short_description: Equality before law; prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth; equality of opportunity in public employment; abolition of untouchability and titles.
notes: Article 14 — Equality before law and equal protection of laws
Article 16 — Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment

fundamental_rights.name: Right to Freedom
fundamental_rights.short_description: Right to freedom including speech and expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, profession; protections in respect of conviction and arrest procedures.
notes: Article 19 — Six freedoms for citizens (speech & expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, profession)
Article 20 — Protection in respect of conviction for offences
Article 21 — Protection of life and personal liberty (right to life and personal liberty)
Article 22 — Protection against arrest and detention in certain cases

fundamental_rights.name: Right against Exploitation
fundamental_rights.short_description: Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour; prohibition of employment of children in hazardous work.
notes: Article 23 — Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour
Article 24 — Prohibition of employment of children in factories, etc.

fundamental_rights.name: Right to Freedom of Religion
fundamental_rights.short_description: Freedom of conscience and right to freely profess, practice and propagate religion; freedom for religious denominations to manage their affairs; limitations subject to public order, morality and health.
notes: Article 25 — Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice & propagation of religion
Article 26 — Freedom to manage religious affairs
Article 27 — Freedom as to payment of taxes for promotion of any particular religion
Article 28 — Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction or religious worship in certain educational institutions

fundamental_rights.name: Cultural and Educational Rights
fundamental_rights.short_description: Protection of interests of minorities: conserve language, script or culture; right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.
notes: Article 29 — Protection of interests of minorities
Article 30 — Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions

fundamental_rights.name: Right to Constitutional Remedies
fundamental_rights.short_description: Right to move the Supreme Court / High Courts for enforcement of fundamental rights; Parliament powers relating to enactment of laws and restrictions in certain circumstances.
notes: Article 32 — Remedies for enforcement of rights (writs: habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, certiorari, quo warranto)
Articles 33-35 — Special provisions, restrictions during martial law, and Parliament's power to make laws
